question.questionText: What role does the path play in determining whether or not a switch affects a bulb?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: If a bulb and a switch are in the same path the switch affects the bulb
The switch and the bulb have to be in the same path

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: if that switch is with the path between that bulb and the battery
the switch, the bulb, and the battery have to be contained in the closed path.
the path plays an important role
switch is contained in a circuit
whether there is a closed path with a battery
The bulb must be contained in a closed path with the battery
a bulb must be in a closed path with a battery and a switch for the switch to affect the bulb
the switch being on or off determines whether the bulb is contained in a closed path with the battery or not
a switch has to be contained in a closed path with no gaps
It plays a significant role. If a switch is open it may or may not interfere with a closed path which is essential to light the bulb
An path with a switch connecting to a battery must be closed
They must be in the same path to affect the bulb.
a switch affects thebulb if it lies along a path that could create a closed circuit
